page.title: 20HEALTH
page.content: The nearest Health Centre is six miles away but a doctor's surgery is held twice weekly at the village hall at midday on Mondays and Fridays. People wishing to consult the doctor in the evening must visit the Health Centre. The nearest general hospital is also six miles away in Grantham. Dispensing is carried out by the local G.P. as the nearest chemist is in Grantham. Childrens' Welfare Clinic is held once a month at the village hall. Dental surgerys are in Grantham or Newark. School children have their ears, eyes and hair checked fairly regularly by the school nurse. A school doctor usually visits the school annually. The area is covered by a Community Nurse.
